version_description:
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).
- Copy and paste buttons in on-screen keyboards now work.

- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).
- Copy and paste buttons in on-screen keyboards now work.

- It is now possible to have multiple active connections to the same profile at the same time.
- Gestures can be configured to switch to the next and previous active connection.
- Fixed function keys above F6 sending wrong control sequences.

Previously:
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).
- Copy and paste buttons in on-screen keyboards now work.

- It is now possible to have multiple active connections to the same profile at the same time.
- Gestures can be configured to switch to the next and previous active connection.
- Fixed function keys above F6 sending wrong control sequences.

Previously:
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).
- Copy and paste buttons in on-screen keyboards now work.

- Added support for locking the app with Touch ID and passcode.
- Updated PuTTY version to 0.67.
- Changed the default bindings for hardware keyboards: Cmd key is now bound to the meta key, and the option key is now bound to alt, so that it can be used to type special characters. These bindings can be changed in input scheme settings.

Previously:
- It is now possible to have multiple active connections to the same profile at the same time.
- Gestures can be configured to switch to the next and previous active connection.
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).
- Copy and paste buttons in on-screen keyboards now work.

- Added support for locking the app with Touch ID and passcode.
- Updated PuTTY version to 0.67.
- Changed the default bindings for hardware keyboards: Cmd key is now bound to the meta key, and the option key is now bound to alt, so that it can be used to type special characters. These bindings can be changed in input scheme settings.

Previously:
- It is now possible to have multiple active connections to the same profile at the same time.
- Gestures can be configured to switch to the next and previous active connection.
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).
- Copy and paste buttons in on-screen keyboards now work.

- Pasting text longer than 256 characters now works again.
- Fixed 3D Touch application shortcuts sometimes not working when Touch ID lock is enabled.

Previously:
- Added support for locking the app with Touch ID and passcode.
- Updated PuTTY version to 0.67.
- It is now possible to have multiple active connections to the same profile at the same time.
- Gestures can be configured to switch to the next and previous active connection.
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).

- Pasting text longer than 256 characters now works again.
- Fixed 3D Touch application shortcuts sometimes not working when Touch ID lock is enabled.

Previously:
- Added support for locking the app with Touch ID and passcode.
- Updated PuTTY version to 0.67.
- It is now possible to have multiple active connections to the same profile at the same time.
- Gestures can be configured to switch to the next and previous active connection.
- Added a setting to change terminal type string.
- Function keys F1-F12 can now be added to the keyboard toolbar (by editing the input scheme).

Added support for terminal color themes! Choose your favorite from the several themes included or make your own.

Added support for unicode emojis. Toggle between color and grayscale emojis in settings.

Other changes:
- Increased maximum font size from 16 to 32.
- Added option for backspace to send Control-H.
- Added key-repeat support for alphanumeric keys on external hardware keyboards (when holding down the key.)
- Fixed xterm 256 colors that were appearing wrong.
- Several other smaller fixes and improvements.

Added support for terminal color themes! Choose your favorite from the several themes included or make your own.

Added support for unicode emojis. Toggle between color and grayscale emojis in settings.

Other changes:
- Increased maximum font size from 16 to 32.
- Added option for backspace to send Control-H.
- Added key-repeat support for alphanumeric keys on external hardware keyboards (when holding down the key.)
- Fixed xterm 256 colors that were appearing wrong.
- Several other smaller fixes and improvements.

- Font size can now be adjusted in smaller steps.
- Added option to sort saved connections by name.
- Fixed "Backspace Sends ^H" setting not working properly on external hardware keyboards.
- Fixed unicode characters in host name causing the app to crash.
- Fixed an issue where tapping the terminal during login prompt caused the app to lock.

Previous notable additions:
- Added support for terminal color themes! Choose your favorite from the several themes included or make your own.
- Added support for unicode emojis. Toggle between color and grayscale emojis in settings.

- Font size can now be adjusted in smaller steps.
- Added option to sort saved connections by name.
- Fixed "Backspace Sends ^H" setting not working properly on external hardware keyboards.
- Fixed unicode characters in host name causing the app to crash.
- Fixed an issue where tapping the terminal during login prompt caused the app to lock.

Previous notable additions:
- Added support for terminal color themes! Choose your favorite from the several themes included or make your own.
- Added support for unicode emojis. Toggle between color and grayscale emojis in settings.

- Fixed a crash issue when using agent forwarding.
- Fixed incorrect parsing of @ characters in usernames.
- Key repeat on hardware keyboards was interfering with some other features such as caps lock, so key repeat for alphanumeric keys is now disabled by default. It can be enabled again in hardware keyboard settings.

Previous notable additions:
- Added support for terminal color themes! Choose your favorite from the several themes included or make your own.
- Added support for unicode emojis. Toggle between color and grayscale emojis in settings.

If you encounter any issues or have feature suggestions, please email support@touchfoo.com

- Fixed a crash issue when using agent forwarding.
- Fixed incorrect parsing of @ characters in usernames.
- Key repeat on hardware keyboards was interfering with some other features such as caps lock, so key repeat for alphanumeric keys is now disabled by default. It can be enabled again in hardware keyboard settings.

Previous notable additions:

- Added support for unicode emojis. Toggle between color and grayscale emojis in settings.

- Added support for iPhone X.
- Fixed user interface issues on iOS 11.
- Disabled Smart Punctuation on iOS 11, which converted ASCII quotes and double-dashes into unicode characters.

Next update with PuTTY 0.70 is coming soon, which brings new features such as support for Ed25519 keys!

If you encounter any issues or have feature suggestions, please email support@touchfoo.com

- Added support for iPhone X.
- Fixed user interface issues on iOS 11.
- Disabled Smart Punctuation on iOS 11, which converted ASCII quotes and double-dashes into unicode characters.

Next update with PuTTY 0.70 is coming soon, which brings new features such as support for Ed25519 keys!

If you encounter any issues or have feature suggestions, please email support@touchfoo.com

Security matters!
- Updated PuTTY to the latest stable release, 0.70, which brings a number of improvements and fixes.
- Full support for Ed25519 keys, including authentication, generation and import/export.
- Support for new OpenSSH private key file format.
- Host key verification support. (By default new hosts are automatically accepted and a warning is given only when a known host's key changes. This behavior can be adjusted in settings, including an option to block all unknown hosts.)
- Host key management: Edit/delete known hosts and manually add host keys.
- Adjust the preferred order of host key, key-exchange and encryption cipher algorithms, and warn when the strength of available algorithms are below desired level.

Other changes:
- Private key files can now be directly imported from other applications such as Mail or Dropbox by using the 'Open In...' function.
- Added an option to disable local password echo.
- Added an option to disable screen auto-lock.

Previously:
- Added support for iPhone X screen and iOS 11.

Security matters!
- Updated PuTTY to the latest stable release, 0.70, which brings a number of improvements and fixes.
- Full support for Ed25519 keys, including authentication, generation and import/export.
- Support for new OpenSSH private key file format.
- Host key verification support. (By default new hosts are automatically accepted and a warning is given only when a known host's key changes. This behavior can be adjusted in settings, including an option to block all unknown hosts.)
- Host key management: Edit/delete known hosts and manually add host keys.
- Adjust the preferred order of host key, key-exchange and encryption cipher algorithms, and warn when the strength of available algorithms are below desired level.

Other changes:
- Private key files can now be directly imported from other applications such as Mail or Dropbox by using the 'Open In...' function.
- Added an option to disable local password echo.
- Added an option to disable screen auto-lock.

Previously:
- Added support for iPhone X screen and iOS 11.

This is a "minor" update that brings a number of requested features:
- Function keys (F1, F2, F3 etc.) are now easily accessible through a single button on the keyboard toolbar. (If you have a customized toolbar, the new function keys button won't be automatically added to it, but you can add it yourself in settings).
- Modifier keys on the toolbar can now be double-tapped to make them "stick".
- A separate paste button can now be added to the toolbar. (Paste is also accessible through the text selection popup as before.)
- Bluetooth keyboard caps lock can now be bound to any other key.
- Saved connections can now be duplicated.
- Font now supports glyphs from the Nerd Fonts project (including Powerline symbols etc.).
- Added an option to show connection log to help troubleshoot connection issues.
- Added an option to ignore accessibility inverted colors.
- Fixed an issue where the application pin code was not reset even if you deleted and reinstalled the application.

Previously:
- Full support for Ed25519 keys, including authentication, generation and import/export.
- Host key verification and management.

This is a "minor" update that brings a number of requested features:
- Function keys (F1, F2, F3 etc.) are now easily accessible through a single button on the keyboard toolbar. (If you have a customized toolbar, the new function keys button won't be automatically added to it, but you can add it yourself in settings).
- Modifier keys on the toolbar can now be double-tapped to make them "stick".
- A separate paste button can now be added to the toolbar. (Paste is also accessible through the text selection popup as before.)
- Bluetooth keyboard caps lock can now be bound to any other key.
- Saved connections can now be duplicated.
- Font now supports glyphs from the Nerd Fonts project (including Powerline symbols etc.).
- Added an option to show connection log to help troubleshoot connection issues.
- Added an option to ignore accessibility inverted colors.
- Fixed an issue where the application pin code was not reset even if you deleted and reinstalled the application.

Previously:
- Full support for Ed25519 keys, including authentication, generation and import/export.
- Host key verification and management.

- Fixed compatibility issues with iPadOS and iOS 13.
- Added support for synchronizing data between devices over iCloud (disabled by default but can be enabled in app settings).
- Updated background connections with new options to extend maximum background connection time.
- Added connection history with optional location tracking.
- Bug fixes and other improvements.

If you encounter any issues or have other feedback, don't hesitate to contact us at support@touchfoo.com

- Fixed UI issues when using the application in split view mode on iPad.
- Fixed key combinations with more than one modifier key not being properly recognized (when using a bluetooth keyboard).

1.3.1:
• Fixed user interface issues that were occurring on iPadOS and iOS 13.
• Bluetooth keyboard Caps Lock key can now be set to toggle ctrl or meta modifier keys.
• Added an option to have arrow key gestures enabled by default.
• Fixed bugs that were found in the previous version. Thanks for reporting them!

1.3.0:
• Fixed compatibility issues with iPadOS and iOS 13.
• Added support for synchronizing data between devices over iCloud (disabled by default but can be enabled in app settings).
• Updated background connections with new options to extend maximum background connection time.
• Added connection history with optional location tracking.

If you encounter any issues or have other feedback, don't hesitate to contact us at support@touchfoo.com

version_name: 1.3.3 fixes several small issues and bugs

version_description:
1.3.2:
• Improved file management to fix cases where the application was unable to open saved connections when iCloud sync was enabled.

1.3.1:
• Bluetooth keyboard Caps Lock key can now be set to toggle ctrl or meta modifier keys.
• Added an option to have arrow key gestures enabled by default.
